page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN HITCHIN
page.content: There are 2 main industrial estates in Hitchin. Both are situated to the north of the town. Bury Mead estate is the smaller. Just over 100 years ago there was a sewage farm here. This developed into the fully automatic sewage treatment works that dominates one side of the estate. It serves a total of 36,000 people and treats 2.25 million gallons of sewage a day. The other side of the estate has many new electronics firms. Several of the older firms have closed down. K.I.R. Gloves is an exception, having been on the estate for over 50 years. The Cadwell Lane estate has a wide cross section of businesses,ranging from high technology firms to a dairy. There are two other industries worthy of note:Russell's (leather) and Ransom's (chemical manufacturers).
